headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Germany: War Criminals Lose Pensions

lead_paragraph: The Labor Ministry has stopped paying pensions to 72 World War II veterans who have been accused of or prosecuted for crimes against humanity, the Jerusalem office of the Simon Wiesenthal Center said. An additional 11 pensions could be canceled in coming weeks and around 250 other investigations are still going on that could lead to prosecutions for war crimes. Germany pays special disability payments to around 60,000 people living outside the country, and until the law was amended in 1998 accused or convicted war criminals abroad were able to receive payments. Victor Homola (NYT)
